intro: Fagara somalensis, commonly known as the Somali arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Fagara somalensis is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region.
